SEARCH
Package fr.foxelia.parity.shop

Class Shop

java.lang.Object
fr.foxelia.parity.shop.Shop
public class Shop extends Object
A class that represents a shop. A shop is a place where you can buy or sell items. The shop can be owned by a player or a city. The shop have multiple parameters like the type of the shop (buy or sell), a decimal price expressed with an Integer, and a limit of items that can be sold or bought. There is no limit to the storage of items.

The rules of the limit are the following:
  • -1 -> No limit
  • 0 -> Disable the shop
  • invalid input: '<'1 -> Limit of x items

The rules of the price are the following:
  • -1 -> No price
  • 0 -> Free
  • >0 -> Price of x
To convert the price to a decimal number, you have to divide the price by 100.
To convert a decimal number to a price, you have to multiply the decimal number by 100.
Since:
release 1.0.0
Version:
1.0
Author:
Zarinoow

      public int getPrice()
      Get the price of the item in the Shop.

      The price is an Integer, to get the correct price with decimals, use the following formula:
      price = price / 100;
      Returns:
      An Integer representing the price of the item in the Shop (including decimals).
      Since:
      release 1.0.0

    • getTaxPrice

      public int getTaxPrice()
      Get the tax added to the price for the item.

      The tax is an Integer, to get the correct tax with decimals, use the following formula:
      tax = tax / 100;
      Returns:
      An Integer representing the tax added to the price of the item in the Shop (including decimals).

      The price is an Integer, to get the correct price with decimals, use the following formula:
      price = price / 100;
      Returns:
      An Integer representing the price of the item with tax (including decimals).

    • canEdit

      public boolean canEdit(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
      Know if the player can edit the current Shop. It can be edited if the player is the owner / admin of the Shop or if the player is an adminitrator of the server.
      Parameters:
      player - The player to check the ability to edit it.
      Returns:
      • true if the player can edit the Shop
      • false if the player can't edit the Shop
      Since:
      release 1.0.0

      Parameters:
      uuid - The uuid of the player to check the ability to edit it.
      Returns:

    • setPrice

      public void setPrice(int price)
      Define the price of the item sold by the Shop.

      The price is an Integer, to define a price with decimals, use the following formula:
      price = (int) (decimalPrice * 100);
      Parameters:
      price - the new price of the item
      Since:
      release 1.0.0

    • addToPrice

      public void addToPrice(int added)
      Increase the price of the item sold by the Shop. You can use a negative number to decrease the price. The new price can't be negative. If the new price is negative, the price will be set to 0.

      The price is an Integer, to define a price with decimals, use the following formula:
      price = (int) (decimalPrice * 100);
      Parameters:
      added - the quantity of money to add to the price
      Since:
      release 1.0.0

    • setType

      public void setType(ShopType type)
      Define the type of the shop (SELL or BUY).
      Parameters:
      type -
      invalid @link 
      ShopType.SELL
      -> Set the shop to sell items
      invalid @link 
      ShopType.BUY
      -> Set the shop to buy items
      Since:
      release 1.0.0

    • setLimit

      public void setLimit(int limit)
      Define the limit of items sold/buy by the shop.
      Parameters:
      limit -
      -1 -> No limit
      0 -> Disable the shop
      >1 -> Limit of x items
      Since:
      release 1.0.0

    • addToLimit

      public void addToLimit(int added)
      Increase the limit of items sold/buy by the Shop. You can use a negative number to decrease the limit.

      The limit change by step :
      • If the limit is -1, and you use a positive number, the limit will be set to 0.
      • If the limit is 0, and you use a positive number, the limit will be set to the number.
      • If the limit is over 0, and you use a positive number, the limit will be increased by the number.
      • If the limit is over 0, and you use a negative number, the limit will be decreased by the number.
      • If the limit is over 0, and the new limit is negative or equals to 0, the limit will be set to 0.
      • If the limit is 0, and you use a negative number, the limit will be set to -1.

      Limit rules :
      • -1 -> No limit
      • 0 -> Disable the shop
      • >1 -> Limit of x items
      Parameters:
      added - the number to add to the limit
      Since:
      release 1.0.0

    • setEditMode

      public void setEditMode(boolean editMode)
      Set if the Shop is in edit mode. This mode is enabled when a player is editing the Shop. This method will also close all ShopInterfaceGUI which are opened for this Shop.
      Parameters:
      editMode -
      • true -> Set the Shop in edit mode and close all opened buy/sell GUI for this shop.
      • false -> Disable the Shop edit mode

    • updateSigns

      public void updateSigns()
      Update all signs display linked to the Shop.
      Since:
      release 1.0.0
